Description: Two sections (each comprising two fragments now joined) of a large wheelmade Nile silt ceramic plate with circular ring-base, shallow and slightly convex sides and everted ledge-rim, the whole is covered with a burnished red-brown slip. An example of Eastern Sigillata A ware from Syria.
Curator's comments: Drawn in Hayes, Handbook of Mediterranean Roman Pottery (BMP 1997), p.53, fig. 18.
Bibliographic references: Hayes 1997 / Handbook of Mediterranean Roman pottery (fig.18)
